Me before my meth addiction vs me after it

Not much can explain or justify my recent actions- I'm not here to apologise just yet because to say you are sorry without changed behaviour is only manipulation- I am going to be taking a wee moment away from social media and really reflect and internalize myself and work on controlling my outbursts and emotional discrepancies. I must work through these burdens of pain and bitterness in order to realign myself to my highest potential. I really didnt think social media would be such a trigger to me at this point but it is and I have so much more to focus on and prioritise in myself at this current time. as much as I appreciate those who are supporting me I also find that this platform enables alot of reckless and immature behaviour on me- This is very scattered because I am high as a kite but I hope you can all allow me the opportunity to change, to grow and to acknowledge my mistakes in my own time... My recent comments I made were inappropriate and attention seeking and I need to readjust my mindset and inform myself on a number of various issues and topics that I still lack adequate knowledge for. I am on the biggest journey to find love and acceptance in myself and I know I can get there, I just need time, patience and Grace. I hope you all take care of yourselves, I'll be sure to do the same and work on nothing but engraining the highest of prospects for myself and others

I composed a Poem last night;
Dear Mrs Meth.

Seeping into the bloodstream, a torch right to the tounge.
You dispersed into my chambers, circulating into my lungs.
Dismantled into the depths of fear, dispatched in a delarious mind.
A final destination, a poison to everything she finds.
A fraction of hesitation, enticed by a cheeky thrill.
She said 'Watch me flip your life around, then send it all downhill'

Infectious initial indulgment, a creamy first timers hit.
Oblivious to the discoveries, desination to a darkened pit.

Flames furnish sacred utilities, in ways which seem so formal.
A fractured crystal, with heat inside- I hope you're acting normal.
Vaporized entities, demons and all the gore.
Consuming fumes with credibility.
I believe my tounge is sore.

Providence to a portal in a state which none compare.
Emerging out the gate with wings, let's reap these sins fuck fear.
Witholding authority & influence, an ability to entice.
Hiding her potential potency, her name was Crystal ice.

Hijack my mind, become unkind.
No soul left to apease.
She states that shes all kinds of fun, but she will bring you to your knees.

Diffusing into the stale thin air,
so soon this heat would come. Transforming pain into despair, a life stripped of all fun.

Warning of all dangers shes invasive in all risks, so lit.
Disregarded, caused by the cravings...all for the next pure, white shard hit... Sinnicle scenes and cosmic laser beams, meth will leave you all distorted.
Subtracted fees, a great big tease.
Meth will leave you soon, unescorted.

It is 2019 - We can do as we dam please. Love who you want to, explore your divinity & don't let anybody conceal you from your Truest self. Love will always win & we can find it within eachothers divine differences. Let's stop this sour segregation we have subsidized ourselves towards & learn to outpour nothing but the highest of affirmations for those and what we cannot comprehend. I cannot wait to go through this next chapter of my journey with elegance and high stance as well as respect for myself & my authenticity, as well as others who Grace me with such... Since I've come out as Trans I've had an overload of emotions and thoughts. Part of me needs to mourn & fully embrace the foreclosure of Liam... Who keeps men in a past continuation of who I once was, but I'm really starting to feel this world like a woman! I've been to the doctor and they have past me onto further pyschistriac care for what I hope will lead to the commencement of my HRT in the next few months. I must embrace this next period with patience and care for myself. Thank you for those who took the time to read this! Sweet, sweet dreams âš˜ğŸ™ğŸ’¥

I live in New Zealand- I am of mixed race... Maori & Irish... Just because my skin is white, that DOES NOT define race.... Most of my mothers family have dark skin why the FUCK would I have any ill intent towards those whose skin tone is of a difference to my own. This is the problem with America & the media... They keep drip feeding this dialogue of racism that it truly has almost turned into a reverse issue... The amount of times I have been called an 'entitled white person' is a JOKE. First of all I am not white so please do not define me as such until you have done research on the suppression my own culture has faced within the confinements of it's own country. Second of all I'm a trans woman... I have had to fight and face enough of the discriminatory slander that the world has thrown at me. So on a final note GET FUCKED I AINT NO RACIST NIGGA BITCH. & also most of the black people coming at me for my viewpoints ain't ever been locked up or faced true belittlement for their ways of being- I HAVE SO GET FUCKED before you label me as racist get your own self in check first because there are lots of racist bitches out there whose skin colour is anything but white... Make sure you are clean yourself before you try drag somebody else down... Does this make you uncomfortable... Because good it should.

Fuck Meth don't ever inhale its poisonous and disruptive fume. It will distort your sense of judgment first and then feast on you mind, playing games. This substance will then seep into your soul and torment you with your greatest insecurities and showcase you your most taunting fears with distortions and altered truths. I can honestly say if you are an open and vulnerable soul like me, DO NOT EVER fuck with meth. Dark entities and energy matter that surround this drug will attempt to hijack you and use your body and mind as a vessel to destroy and cause chaos. The first high is bait because you will never achieve one like it again, it's not worth it. I am very sick at the moment, and I must heal. I must refine myself and rebuild as strong of a core being as I can, practicing resilience everyday. I know if i continue with my addiction it's going to absolutely strip me of everything I've known and leave me as an empty skeleton. I DONT WANT THAT

I must face up to THIS. And confront all my demons so I can discard of them for good. This addiction will NOT overthrow me.

It is a huge transition for anyone to go from â€œI can do whatever I wantâ€ to being responsible for a very tiny creature who you hope to raise into a functioning, not-hating-you-as-and-adult person. Itâ€™s so hard. So take time to give thanks and appreciation for whoever fills that mother role in your life. They totally deserve everything you can give them! <3 #happymothersday

Iâ€™ve been thinking a lot lately about my role in life, what my proper function is in this world. Itâ€™s an age-old existential question: â€œWhy am I here?â€ Itâ€™s all too easy to fall into a cynical pit of despair, esp. in this hyper-connected world. All you have to do is see the news & you can easily start adopting a combative nihilistic attitude- â€œLook at all this strife, both domestically & internationallyâ€“ whatâ€™s the point?â€ And maybe things are, in fact, pointlessâ€“ maybe we are screwed. However, if thatâ€™s the case, I know I feel better in this pointless existence if Iâ€™m at least TRYING to make things better- I also donâ€™t like giving up, it feels weak. So I have to look at what Iâ€™m good at; what my history has qualified me to do- in a macro sense, Iâ€™m good at making music, writing, & photography- Iâ€™m an artist. People have told me that art Iâ€™ve made, no matter how poor, has helped them. So I need to make the best art that I can, whether itâ€™s music, prose, or photos; art with SUBSTANCE & INTENT. On a personal, micro-level, Iâ€™m good at relating to people with substance abuse problems, because I was a freaking train wreck for over two decades. So I need to talk, ONE ON ONE, & IN PERSON, with people like me- drunks & drug addicts- & at least try to let them know that there is a better way. I canâ€™t cure anyone- no one can- but I can at least show them that just in this very moment, right now, TODAY... I am still on the other side of a long struggle with the bottle. Other people did that for me; they SHOWED ME it was possible- if Iâ€™m not willing to do the same, then I am just an asshole. So when I look at this photo of this man passed out drunk on the street, I canâ€™t view it as â€œLook at that scummy bum!â€, but instead as â€œIâ€™ve been that man passed out on the street. I cannot judge him. I can only see that he is still alive, & therefore, has a chance at getting better- maybe when he wakes up, heâ€™ll be sober enough to accept help.â€ Performing my broader proper functions to the best of my ability, & trying to relate on a INDIVIDUAL level, is the best way I can help bring about positive change. This is something to think about- WHAT IS YOUR FUNCTION? #LeicaM240p

â€œWonderfulâ€ Frankfurt, Germany. 7.1.2019. I took this shot of @greghetson backstage when my band played in Frankfurt a couple of weeks ago- heâ€™s touring Europe w/@markyramoneofficial & came out to see lamb of god play on a day off. Greg played in Redd Kross, @badreligionband, & of course was (and is) an OG member of the mighty @circlejerksband. In between getting ready to play & trying not to fanboy out too hard on him (because I know how annoying that shit is), I suddenly realized â€œHoly crap, this dude played the first show I ever got thrown out of!â€ In 1988 the Circle Jerks were on tour w/@official7seconds- I went to see them play at The Boathouse in Norfolk, VA. I watched all of 7 Seconds, & made it about 1/4 of the way through the Circle Jerks before this huge bouncer with a long-ass coke nail threw my skinny ass out the side door- this happened during one of my favorite Circle Jerks songs, â€œMaking the Bombs.â€ I donâ€™t remember exactly why I got thrown out out- it could have been fighting. It could have been drinking (I was only 17 at the time, but it would not surprise me.) Or it could have been for nothing at all (that shit happened from time to time, especially if the bouncer was an asshole, which this one definitely was.) What I do remember is that he cut my thumb with his pointy-ass coke nail, & up until a year or two ago, I could still plainly see the scar- itâ€™s really faint now, but itâ€™s still there. Man, I was mad at that bouncer- I tried to punch him but he just laughed & tossed my scrawny teen-aged ass almost into the water beside the Boathouse ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚. The dude I came to the show with left w/a hot punk rock girl too, & I was stuck in the parking lot alone & all pissed off with a bleeding thumb. DAMMIT, MAN- as Charles Manson (supposedly) said â€œSometimes, things just donâ€™t work out.â€ Anyways, that was the first show I ever got the boot from, & Mister Hetson was there onstage rocking & rolling away, so it was really cool for me to have him come see us perform 31 years later (conversely, Greg was very well behaved & did NOT get thrown out of our show.) Thanks @michael.agel for loaning me the #leica #Q2 I took this photo with! #LeicaQ2

Two books: â€œ10 Arguments For Deleting Your Social Media Right Nowâ€ by Jaron Lanier & â€œDigital Minimalismâ€ by Cal Newport. Both logically flesh out a glaringly obvious problem: we spend way too much time looking at little screens, & as a result we are suffering. Sean Parker, billionaire inventor of Napster & early Facebook investor spoke publicly at a 2017 Axios event about designing social mediaâ€™s addictive properties: 'The inventors, creatorsâ€”it's me, it's Mark [Zuckerberg], it's Kevin Systrom on Instagram, it's all of these people--understood this consciously. And we did it anyway.' I know that I spend way too much time looking at Instagram, YouTube, & the horror show 24/7 news cycle. So for 31 days Iâ€™m deleting Instagram/Youtube from my phone & moving my web browser to a folder off my home screen. For the news (which I compulsively check, constantly cross-referencing about 7 different outlets varying from far left to far right leaning in order to get a feel for the average â€œspin of the dayâ€- WHY? I already know what they are going to say!), Iâ€™m only going to look at WWW.ALLSIDES.COM which presents 3 different stories on each major news item (one each from a left, right, & center weighted news network), with no ads. Instagram is my only social media, & as it has brought REAL-WORLD value to my life, not just â€œlikesâ€, which are empty digital baubles designed to give cheap serotonin hits (real world value Iâ€™ve gotten: information & business connections in photography, writing, music, & acting/ the ability to promote other artists & charitable causes I support/ actual in-person lasting friendships/ & most importantly... a growing surfing posse ğŸ˜‚), Iâ€™m not ready to delete my account. But itâ€™s obvious that I need to evaluate my relationship w/this technology, & change it for the better. Why am I posting this instead of just vanishing? Because I hope it will make YOU, the reader, dig deep & ask yourself an honest question: WHAT AM I ACTUALLY USING THIS TECHNOLOGY FOR? Does it make you feel NERVOUS to think about stepping away from it? If so, that might be worth examining. See you in 31 days with a report- live long & prosper. Deleting in 3, 2, 1....#leicaM10p #leica

â€œWind Songâ€ Outer Banks, NC. 8.29.2019 Iâ€™m watching Hurricane Dorian very closelyâ€“ as an East Coast surfer, I have a love/hate relationship with the hurricanes & tropical storms that hit us every year around this timeâ€“ all of us who surf here do. While we love the big waves they create, we hate the destruction they bring. Itâ€™s perfect when hurricanes form and stay out to sea, bringing us waves but not smashing into the land or creating massive storm surge. Regrettably, as of right now Dorian doesnâ€™t look like a storm that is gonna play nice & just give us pretty waves- in fact itâ€™s a Category 5, currently ripping into the Bahamas (oh btw, now is actually an appropriate time for â€œthoughts & prayersâ€ for the people on those islands), then itâ€™s gonna travel up the Southern East Coast on a still undecided path. If you are a new transplant to our coast, my advice is prepare for the absolute worst & be ready to leave. Donâ€™t think that the government is gonna come in, save you, and fix everything, because they ainâ€™t- hell, FEMA hasnâ€™t even had confirmed leadership since March, just an acting administrator, & itâ€™s not like they are gonna replace everything you lost anyway- thatâ€™s not their job. So gas up the car & be ready to split ASAP- it looks like it could get ugly. If youâ€™ve never ridden out a hurricane, I can promise you itâ€™s like nothing youâ€™ve ever experienced before- it makes a regular thunder storm look like a trip to Disney Land. So shout out to all my locals in FL, GA, SC, & NC- yâ€™all already know what to do. To you newcomers, Iâ€™d advise you watch this storm, take it seriously, & be ready to split waaaaay before it gets near you. PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT: I try & post this every summer, because itâ€™s beach season & tons of people come from inland & every single year, WITHOUT FAIL, people drown because they do not understand the ocean & rip currents- just like a 22 year old dude from Iowa who died in Florida two days ago on his honeymoon- it was his first time swimming in the ocean. Inlanders, pay attention: THE OCEAN IS NOT A SWIMMING POOL OR A LAKE. It has its own rules, & you have to learn & respect them. A rip current is a sort of river flowing out into the ocean- if you are caught in one, it will carry you out to sea, & it will do so very quickly. If you are swimming or even standing in shallow water & notice that suddenly you are far away from the beach, & that you canâ€™t seem to swim back, you are more than likely caught in a rip current. #1. DO NOT PANIC. A rip current isnâ€™t going to carry you a mile out to sea, & itâ€™s not gonna â€œsuck you underâ€- there is no such thing as an â€œundertowâ€ (yes, I know my band has a song called â€œThe Undertowâ€.) Just chill & donâ€™t try to fight it- if you panic & fight it, you will get tired quickly & drown. #2. DO NOT TRY TO SWIM DIRECTLY BACK TOWARDS SHORE- instead, SWIM PARALLEL TO SHORE- most of the time this will get you out of the rip current & you can make your way back. Rip currents are scary, even for experienced swimmers- Iâ€™ve been in the ocean since I was four years old, & a few years ago I got caught in a weird rip/sink hole thing at Manhattan Beach in Cali. I was starting to get freaked out until I just swam a mere ten yards to my right & popped out of it, no problem. One minute I was in knee deep water, & within seconds I was wondering why I was in up to my neck & couldnâ€™t get back in- it was scary. DONâ€™T PANIC & YOU WONâ€™T DROWN. Also, if you are not a strong enough swimmer to swim the length of a football field no problem, you probably shouldnâ€™t be cruising out into the ocean very far at all. Those are just facts. Ok, PSA done. Enjoy the beach, pick up your trash (& other peoples), & donâ€™t forget sunscreen- there is nothing more tragic than ruining your vacation by looking like a boiled lobster & feeling like youâ€™re ON FIRE.

Just got the news from @garyholt_official that our buddy @terry_w_butlerâ€™s daughter recently died in a car crash. Terry is currently the bass player in MY FAVORITE DEATH METAL BAND OF ALL TIME, the almighty @obituaryband. Iâ€™ve toured & done gigs across the globe with him w/Obituary & during his time in Six Feet Under- heâ€™s always been awesome to me & my posse, just an all around gentle giant & class act, so my heart aches for his loss. The only good thing about this is that his grandsons (who were in the wreck) survived & are ok- now they are living with Terry, who has had to leave tour (Obituary are on the road with Hatebreed still) to come home & take care of his family. This is a blessing, but here is the reality of the situation- in our community, you can be in a band and tour the world and have fans and still not be a bazillionaire. A sudden tragedy like this can put a severe financial strain on a touring musician, ESPECIALLY if they canâ€™t tour- itâ€™s how we make a living, and if you want to be rich, you sure as hell arenâ€™t gonna choose a career in death metal, of all things. Thatâ€™s just REALITY, so a GoFundMe page has been established to help Terry out with raising his grandsons. The other reality of the situation is that in the underground music scene, WE TAKE CARE OF OUR OWN- Iâ€™ve seen it time and time again. So the link to the GoFundMe is IN MY BIO- if you can spare a few bucks, please take a second & kick down- I just did. The dude already raised his children, now heâ€™s got to raise his grandchildren, & that costs money. So if youâ€™ve ever rocked out to an Obituary, Six Feet Under, or Death song, kick down a few bucks- Terryâ€™s a legend who played in all those bands- this is his life, it has always been his life, & it ainâ€™t like heâ€™s suddenly gonna become a rich lawyer or something. Thanks for your time in reading this, & Terry, Iâ€™m so sorry for your loss. Love to you & your family. - D. Randall Blythe

â€œShagri-Laâ€ 10.17.2019 The Pacific Ocean. (PLEASE SEE PREVIOUS POST) Today ends my 31 day social media hiatus (Instagram is my only form of social media.) What did I find? I did NOT miss it; furthermore, I did not miss ANYTHING important- life goes on just fine without social media. Who cares about missing the intellectually lightweight idiocy of memes, ill thought-out online political arguments, trolls of all sorts, & freaking selfies? Not me- my brain is clearer without that stuff. So while I will use Instagram to post stuff I care about (AS A TOOL, not just something to kill time), I will no longer have it on my phone (Iâ€™ll just erase it after each post- POOF!) As for my attempt to not look at news sites so much... embarrassingly, I must admit to TOTAL FAILURE. Iâ€™m a news/politics junkie, & still found myself checking multiple sites several times a day, even though I KNOW BETTER & am aware of sensationalism & bias in the news media, both left & right (heck, I even wrote a song about it, â€œEngage the Fear Machineâ€) Still I got suckered into the endless horror show, & made these douchebags more advertiser dollars with every click (because that is what itâ€™s all about people- ADVERTISING DOLLARS.) As an alcoholic who has been sober several years now, Iâ€™m keenly aware of when Iâ€™m displaying addictive behavior- it doesnâ€™t feel good. These â€œsmart phonesâ€ (originally solely designed just so you wouldnâ€™t have to carry an iPod & a phone at the same time) are distraction machines. So Iâ€™m installing an app that restricts the web browser on my phone in order to curtail this ridiculous news habit of mine. Sad, but true. I took this photo on a cruise ship my band played on- as we were at sea, there was no cell service or internet. I heard people complaining as if this was some sort of savage punishment- for me, it was paradise, hence the title of this photo (if you donâ€™t know what Shangri-La is, read â€œLost Horizonâ€- in fact, just read a book in general. Itâ€™s way better for you than looking at social media.) Iâ€™m not anti-technology, or against smart phones or even social media- just the way they are used most of the time. Are you using technology, or being used? Think...

â€œShine on, Bright Starâ€ Hollywood, CA. 1.5.2019 It is with a heavy heart that I must bid this young man, @thecameronboyce, a peaceful journey on his trip to the great beyond. I met Cameron working in Hollywood- we did some acting together for an upcoming production. Cameron was a Disney child actor, now growing into a young man- he was just 20 years old when he died last night of natural causes due to an ongoing medical condition. Despite being famous as a child star, he was as about as down to earth as a person could get, which greatly impressed me- there was absolutely zero sense of entitlement about him. We had a lot of laughs on set, not to mention good talks on the nature & perils of fame. Cameron was incredibly talented- he could dance, sing, & was a brilliant actor with a great sense of humor & a genuine curiosity about the world- just truly a joy to watch perform. I would watch him on set doing his thing & think â€œMan- heâ€™s SO GOOD.â€ Incidentally, his paternal grandmother, Jo Ann (Allen) Boyce, is a Civil Rights icon, one of the first 12 African-Americans to attend an integrated high school in the south, in 1956- I believe that this sort of upbringing lead to his strength of character, & philanthropic nature. Although he & I came from very different worlds- the Disney scene & the heavy metal music world are pretty much polar opposites- we got along well & I was really looking forward to seeing & working with him again. I extend my most sincere condolences to Cameronâ€™s family & friends. The world needs more socially aware & kind hearted young men, & we certainly lost a good one last night. I took this photo on set- you can see the kindness in his eyes. Safe journey, bro- see you on the other side. #ripcameronboyce #Leica #LeicaCamera #LeicaCameraUSA #LeicaM #LeicaM10P #LeicaM10Ptyp3656 #ğŸ”´ğŸ“· #Summilux #Summilux50mm #LeicaCraft #MyLeicaJourney #MKexplore #drandallblythe #RatsEyesPhotography #HoneTheAesthetic

Yesterday I went to @fountainbookstore to sign a ton of copies of my book, Dark Days, for people who ordered it. Iâ€™m posting about this (as I always do) to let people know that they can avoid the hideously over-priced EBay Vampires ($60 to $85 to even almost $300) & get a signed, even personalized copy of my book (hardback or softcover) at a REGULAR PRICE. Also, you will be supporting a locally-owned, independent business. I SUPPORT INDEPENDENT BUSINESSES!!! I bought 2 books yesterday (as I almost always do when I go to @fountainbookstore.) Now, to answer a few questions that always get asked when I do this:

A) â€œWill @fountainbookstore ship to Canada/Italy/Cambodia/any-other-country-that-is-not-the-USA?â€ Yes. They will ship ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD.

B) â€œWhen will you go to Fountain next to sign books?â€ When I get around to it- I travel A LOT, not just with my band. Normally I go down there to sign every 3 or 4 months or so. Fountain contacts me when they have a bunch of orders together & I go sign. PATIENCE, grasshopper! C) â€œI already own your book- can I send it to the bookstore for you to sign & send back to me?â€ No. This is a bookSTORE, not Randyâ€™s P.O. Box. They need to SELL BOOKS to stay alive. If you already have my book & we ever meet, I will be MORE THAN HAPPY to sign it to you, absolutely free of charge! And no, you canâ€™t send it to me- I am untrustworthy & lazy & always busy doing a zillion things already. I will most likely lose your book or sell it to fund a surf trip.
D) â€œWill you make it out to: Micronishiz Zelda the Valkyrie Conquerer?â€ Yes. I will personalize it to anyone, no matter how weird your name is. Yes, I will say â€œHappy Anniversary, Beckyâ€ or whatever. No, I will not write â€œI love youâ€ on it- DONâ€™T BE CREEPY. No, I will not write out all the lyrics to (insert lamb of god song here.) Also, sorry- I will NO LONGER be enclosing my spectacular nude self-portraits with each order. The demand was WAAAAAAY too high, & the government was trying to hit me with unlicensed pornography distribution charges.
E) â€œHow do I order your book?â€ Go to WWW.FOUNTAINBOOKSTORE.COM, look around, search for â€œDark Daysâ€ & it will pop up!

ppl have been asking why i deleted my posts so i figured iâ€™d take this opportunity to address it. after almost 4 years of doing emoji portraits i have decided it is time to level up. i took a long introspective look at myself i have realized i was making art that wasnâ€™t true to who i am. i know iâ€™m capable of greater things and i want this to be a platform to show u that. therefore i have this deleted all my post to focus on my next endeavor and lifelong passion: clout pics. enjoy this one of me in foreign shoes and free supreme.

the orange fit symbolizes the flame that radiates light, the color of the sun that shines infinitely, a blazing sphere within the depth of darkness that sears away all ignorance, illuminating day and night. it is also a symbol of cleanliness that diminishes defilements, clearing them from the mind. finally, it is symbol of purity, like the pure gold found in nature. the wearer must be pure in body, speech, and mind to eliminate defilements from the world and life.

What a photo. I realized today the 4 of us were gonna be in the same place. @tajlucas @rubenalcantara @t1ers and I were apart of the @etniesbmx team. We all had signature shoes by Etnies in the early 2000s . It was during a time that the 4 of us all had an opportunity to influence 4 very specific, but different kinds of riders. It was a special time for us and Bmx. I feel lucky I got to be apart of a time that helped shape generations of future bike riders with these guys. We toured together, competed against each other, traveled all over the world as teammates ,at times hated each other and respected each other. Iâ€™ve learned something from each one of them. Some of my biggest early life lessons was from Taj. Driving from OKC to Ann Arbor Michigan then to Bethlehem, Pa. when I was probably 17. Which are things that I still check myself on. Weâ€™ve all done a lot of growing over the past 25 years of knowing each other. Some wonderful , some growing pains. But I have to say it was really nice seeing all of you today. What a wonderful journey we all went on. #betheadventure #etnies #bmx #forward #grounded #travel

DEAD WEIGHT. Earlier this year I had skydive accident that I didnâ€™t see coming while working a commercial. As you can see from this picture I pretty much look dead. My canopy deployed instantaneously. So instead of going from 130 Ish mph to maybe 20 mph gradually over 6-10 seconds it happened in about a half second. Which was like getting hit by a truck. the impact of the jerk was so harsh I actually thought someone else ran into me in the air. The initial jerk blacked me out from the G- forces, bruised my chin on my chest from it hitting it and vice Versa, caused 2 full leg strap bruises, bent and tweaked my back as it stopped me and kinked my neck and cracked my neck like Iâ€™ve never had happen before. As you can see the filmer @travisfienhage caught the whole opening right in front of him, which isnâ€™t normal. I got lucky, my buddy @brandonlillard broke his back on something similar and I was told necks get broken like this every once in awhile. Luckily I fully came too about 30-60 seconds after this. Took a few seconds to evaluate myself shake off the daze as much as I could check my gear and fly to my landing area where I came in on my butt and just sat there for a bit cause I was still very much in pain and disoriented. Thankful I have guys like @travisfienhage in my corner constantly testing me and reminding me to stay up to date, aware and just all around in general never to get complacent in what we do. We studied the footage to see if I had done something that caused it - Still not sure why it happened, could of been the packers error not tucking my slider correct, could of been just dumb luck, doesnâ€™t much matter to me - but I learned a huge lesson that day - things happen you have no control over. All you can do is be mentally prepared for it all. #betheadventure #skydive #outdoors #slam #canopy @gopro #gopro #gpathlete

The images, like life, are ephemeral. Once pasted, the art piece lives on its own. The sun dries the light glue and with every step, people tear pieces of the fragile paper. The process is all about participation of volunteers, visitors, and souvenir catchers.

This project is also about presence and absence, about reality and memories, about impermanence.

#JRauLouvre

An agricultural prayer (a short film to come in collaboration with Alice Rohrwacher) (making of the film on the highlighted stories)

For the small peasants, who have kept us alive for thousands of years.
For all those who through the centuries have protected springs and forests to leave our children a planet as fertile as they found it.
Let us pray.
For all those peasants without a name who have preserved seeds and guarded their know-how and given it â€“ not sold it â€“ to the future generations. For all those peasants who have protected and delivered us the greatest wealth there is: biodiversity.
Let us pray.
For the unknown person who planted the hedges to live together with animals and insects, who planted trees to give shade and relief to flocks and shepherds.
For all those who didnâ€™t poison what feeds us.
Let us pray.
For all those peasants who suffered misery and poverty but offered the world beauties and marvels and landscapes.
For this moving testimony whereby human beings can live in harmony with nature, not geared toward profit and without destroying all ressources.
For all those peasants who have been exploited and humiliated by the landlords of all the times.
Let us pray.

The short film 'Les Bosquets' -2015- brings the audience in a place where art, social uproar and the power of image interweave. It is based on the performance of Les Bosquets at New York City Ballet -2014-, inspired by the riots in the French suburbs in 2005. JR initiated his first project, Portrait of a Generation, in 2004, in the suburbs of Les Bosquets, in Clichy-Montfermeil.This iconic image is the poster of the film.

30 YEARS AGO â€¦ Walls, walls, walls... On Nov. 9, 1989 the Berlin Wall fell. A few weeks ago, I installed a GIANT in Berlin on the Brandenburg Gate. I used an archival image made by Iris Hesse on November 10, 1989, on this place symbolizing the division then the reunification of Germany.
I work frequently around walls. The walls that separate, (Face2Face and Kikito); the walls that are destroyed at a loss for the memory of a place (Wrinkles of the City, Destruction serie in Les Bosquets); the walls that we try to build again, in concrete or in our minds. The Brandenburg Gate was part of a wall that represented the division of Europe following the failure of a mass murder ideology. It separated women and men who lived in two opposite systems of thought. The opening of this Gate has kindled a wind of freedom that has engulfed millions of Europeans
Iris Hesse / Ullstein Bild / Roger-Viollet

After our first collaboration in #Cuba, during the 13th Havana Biennial, we are pleased to announce the continuity of our projects, the next ones in Italy and again in #Cuba, with #JR, an artist that exhibits freely in the streets of the world and celebrates people.
_
#JR work mixes Art and Action; it talks about commitment, freedom, identity and limit. Sharing the same desire of opening conversations, starting dialogues
and building connections between people through Art. We very much look forward to more exciting adventures together!
_
The artistâ€™s largest exhibition to date is currently presented at the #BrooklynMuseum, in New York! Entitled'JR: Chronicles' the exhibition traces the artist's career from his early documentation of graffiti artists as a teenager in Paris to his large-scale architectural interventions in cities worldwide to his more recent digitally collaged murals that create collective portraits of diverse publics.
_
Artwork: JR 'GIANTS', Alain, April 13, 11.05 a.m., Havana, Cuba, 2019

Pace is pleased to present 'The Chronicles of San Francisco - Sketches,' an exhibition of new work by French artist and photographer JR (@jr), on view at Paceâ€™s gallery in Palo Alto from February 6 â€“ March 24, 2019. Encompassing portraits, works on paper, video installations, lightboxes, and etched glass works, the exhibition is derived from and inspired by JR's upcoming monumental mural project 'The Chronicles of San Francisco,' opening at SFMOMA (@SFMOMA) in Spring 2019.
-
Known for his large-scale urban works that address socio-economic and political issues, JR created the new series in honor of the city and people of #SanFrancisco. The cityâ€™s long muralist tradition and its stark contrastsâ€”featuring both immense innovation and wealth as well as one of the countryâ€™s highest rates of child homelessnessâ€”has made it a vibrant and complex site for the artist to explore and capture. Over the course of the project, nearly 1,200 people were filmed, photographed and interviewed; each person choosing the way they were to be represented in the mural.
-
â€œIn a painting, itâ€™s usually the perspective that focuses the attention of the viewer. With this new mural technique, we break the perspective: Every person is presented at the same size, captured with the same light. No one is more important than another. It is not a group photo, but rather a group of photos...The mural aims to be a picture of society, not depicting good and bad, but rather showing that both sides are present in everyone.â€â€”#JR
-

Questloveâ€™s special guest at this Sundayâ€™s Midsummer Night Conversations on Creativity is Mark Ronson! Get your tickets now at guildhall.org/questlove
Mark Ronson is an internationally renowned DJ and Academy-Award-winning, seven-time-Grammy-Award-winning and Golden Globe-winning artist and producer. He has worked on a multi Grammy-winning album by Amy Winehouse, as well as his own Grammy-winning, global smash hit with Bruno Mars, 'Uptown Funk.' Along with releasing four successful albums under his own name, his resume includes production work for some of musicâ€™s biggest names, including Adele, Paul McCartney, Duran Duran, and Lily Allen. More recently, he helmed Lady Gagaâ€™s acclaimed fifth album, Joanne and Queens Of The Stone Ageâ€™s lauded Villains. In 2018 he released a string of singles with Diplo under the name Silk City, including the current worldwide hit â€œElectricityâ€ with Dua Lipa, which earned him a Grammy Award for â€œBest Dance Recordingâ€ in 2019.He is a co-writer of the song â€œShallow,â€ recorded by Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper for the movie A Star Is Born, for which he earned an Academy Award for â€œBest Original Song,â€ a Golden Globe Award for â€œBest Song Written for a Motion Picture,â€ a Grammy Award for â€œBest Song Written for Visual Media,â€ and a Grammy nomination for â€œSong of the Year.â€Most recently Mark collaborated with Miley Cyrus on the hit song, â€œNothing Breaks Like A Heart,â€ Lykke Li on â€œLate Night Feelings,â€ Camila Cabello on â€œFind U Againâ€ and more, for his fifth studio album Late Night Feelings, which was released in June. He is currently based in Los Angeles where he operates his record label, Zelig Records, home to fast rising star King Princess. To date, Ronson has 1 Academy Award, 7 Grammy Awards, 2 Brit Awards, 1 Golden Globe Award, and 1 MTV VMA Award to his name.

You may not know her but damn if #KatreeseBarnes didnâ€™t effect us w her music in some way shape or form. Rnb/Boogie genre fans (& hip hop heads that have #AZâ€™s Do Or Die Album) of course remember her forever classic jam #SugarFree back when her band with her brother Jerry (#Juicy) was hittin (old school heads remember #BeatStreetStrut too from the movie)â€”- In a move that Iâ€™m borderline certain she herself couldnâ€™t call, she made her mark in history as co-writer/producer of some of the most hilarious memorable musical moments of SNLâ€™s history. Including the groundbreaking mega viral and Emmy winning #DickInABox (but all of those songs from 2006-2011 era â€”-including my fav jam The Mcgruber theme & the â€œYay/Nayâ€ Senate song Will Forte did in weekend update that I prolly watched 50leven times. She was really supportive and so happy for us when we took the Late Night gig w Jimmy. She ALWAYS took time out to school/show us ropes on this new MD/musician union/tv scoring life we just got into. I also recognized she looked out for all of the true masters often hooking them up w gigs too (was always wonder for the longest â€œWhy all the great session singers of NYCs past were ALWAYS at NBC?â€ Such a sad loss for the music community on a whole. Kind soul and beautiful sister. Rest In Melody

John Witherspoon resonated with every last one of us because he represented someone in our family: embarrassing us at gatherings (Boomerang), misrepresenting our generations heroes (â€œPublic Enemaâ€?!), making a jingle about pretty much everything (Grandpa on Boondocks), the neighborhood wino (black Jesusâ€”-or better yet Hollywood Shuffle)â€”-the list is endless. Bar none my favorite working/blue collar actor. Prolly THE most famous iconic character actor (I mean he didnâ€™t star in vehicles but he was no doubt THE go to support) the best knew to get the best. When interviewing @davidalangrier on @QLS him describing what should have been a routine 15 min scene at the family table in Boomerang wound up being a non stop hour and a half us master class riffing amongst masters, with Witherspoon leading the way. History should tell it well, all the greats utilized him on their project for the last 45 years (Richard Pryor Show/Whats Happening!/Good Times/WKRP/227/Martin/Amen/Fresh Prince/Wayans Bros/Living Single/Boondocks/First Family/blackish/Black Jesus)â€”-he will forever be our pop pops. RIP

The last post about the climate march ruffled some feathers. As a photojournalist, I have become increasingly aware of how my travel impacts the environment, and I do everything necessary to offset my footprint. This year I took one of my first vacations, in many years, to Mexico, where I experienced a sustainable hospitality model. Tomorrow, I'm on my way back to research, explore, photograph and report on what makes a sustainable hospitality model work. I'll be traveling to the delicate ecosystem that has been ravaged by tourisim: #Tulum, #Mexico. Stay tuned for more stories from the field as I dive deep into what makes hospitality entreprenuers, communities and travelers unite for a common good.

In the mean time, I want to know your questions, concerns, thoughts feelings about travel and tourism. Comment below!

Some recent conversations have brought my memories to float back in time to my first story for #NatGeo. The â€œSky Caves of Mustangâ€ are a large collection of 10,000 or more man-made caves dug into the sides of a valley in northern #Nepal. Archeologists and researchers have explored a fraction of these caves and have found mummified human remains dating to at least 2,000-3,000 years old. .
As the world becomes smaller, exploration and discovery shifts and changes in meaning as well. Archeologists on our expedition required the support of climbers, like myself and @mattsegal, to access these caves. Just as the printing press changed history, advent of digital dissemination of not just the written word, but visual stories have altered the way we connect, research, explore and communicate. How do you feel discovery, exploration and science has changed through new world of Instagram? .
Pictured here: a cave illuminated with researchers' lamps while exploring the sky caves of Mustang.
#mustang #exploration #discovery #adventure

Some have been asking if we are on assignment for #natgeo in Mustang, Nepal to continue examining the sky Caves, a story from almost 10 years ago. This assignment we are shifting from the past to the present. The team and I are documenting how traditional practices and ways of living are adapting to the intrusion of modernity. Buddhism, roads, connectivity, migration, monarchies, climate change and tourism all place new pressures upon these ancient cultures while offering new opportunities.
.

Just like climbing, projects like these are a team effort. @jetbutterflies @abovethecloudstrav @standtallest @climber.abiral are on the ground with me, and Iâ€™m grateful for all the ways they contribute, support and continually sculpt the vision into a reality in an effort to give life to a story that must be seen by the global community.
.
Pictured here: A monk in a Mustang monastery performs a #puja, or an act of worship, in 2010 from my assignment with @natgeo magazine exploring the archeological mysteries of Mustang, Nepal.
#archeology #journalism #photojournalism #culture #travel #tourism #portrait #nepal

Changpa Nomad, Ladakh 2018. The Changpa are a semi-nomadic Tibetan people found mainly in the Changtang in Ladakh and in Jammu and Kashmir. A smaller number resides in the western regions of the Tibet Autonomous Region and were partially relocated for the establishment of the Changtang Nature Reserve. // shot using a single B1 light with a collapsible beauty dish.
#travel #portrait #culture #natgeo #india #nomad

As we start our assignment for #natgeo in Nepal, it's common to come across Mani Stones. Mani stones are plates or rocks inscribed with the 6 syllables Tibetan Buddhist mantra 'Om Mani Padme Hum'. They can be found everywhere--from the sides of roads and rivers to the walls of temples. Carving these stones can also be a devotional practice, or 'sadhana'.
.
There are many translations of this mantra, and @dalailama says 'The six syllables..can transform your impure body, speech, and mind into the pure body, speech and mind of the Buddha... All beings naturally have Buddha nature... We have within us the seed of purity, the Buddha-Essence, that can be transformed and fully developed.'
.
Pictured here: Mani Stones on my way to #everest in 2012 with @conrad_anker @hilareenelson @emilyaharrington for @natgeo

#everest Route Report: As some of you have seen from my stories, @estebantopomena and I have been preparing gear and nutrition for the route. Many have asked if we are about to go climb, but the honest answer is the winds are high and we are bored. So, to occupy our time, as well as to keep the psych level up, we started preparing what we could. Based on weather, we most likely wonâ€™t be able to get on the new route again for another 2 weeks. Thank you everyone for the well wishes, the prayers, the kind thoughts and the funny notes. It helps us pass the time and makes it all feel a little less lonely.
Regardless of being psyched and excited it still is a mental challenge to battle the internal conversations of loneliness, fear and everything in between. With May being #mentalhealthawarenessmonth, it is important to me to share both the good and the realities that come with climbing this route, not just as an alpinist, but as someone who lives with #bipolar and an advocate for furthering the conversation around #mentalhealth
Pictured here, Topo and I maneuver to the base of the route to stow our gear for when the time is right. Planning and preparations is integral to a successful and safe climb.

#mountains #adventure #climbing #training #mentalhealthawareness
Reclamation in process. Shot #onassignment for #natgeotravel in the Andaman Islands, India.

Photo @estebantopomena 1st attempt: @estebantopomena and I only spent 40 hours on the wall with one open bivvy at 7300 m (around 24,000 ft). The conditions we encountered coupled with our chosen tactics compounded by exertion meant that we had to turn back at around 7,600 m. Downclimbing safely took another 7 hours from our high point. Back in ABC and reassessing our approach, we are looking into the early days of June for a potential second window and attempt. Is it a failure? In the most strict sense of the word, Absolutely. But is it a building block? For sure. I've always maintained that this is truly a journey vs. a summit sport. But to truly understand the whole process, you have to get to the summit. Fingers crossed that happens this season.

Adventure can be experienced in many ways. Culturally, adventure is associated with adrenaline and sports that enduce a thrill. Adventure to me, though, is discovery. It is the peeling back of layers to reveal truth...the truth that is inside me or the truth that surrounds all of us.

In Mustang, Nepal, almost 10 years ago, I was fortunate enough to expienece the merging of the adventure of sport with the adventure of archeological discovery. Maybe I long to be back here over and over because of the lessons I learned, mostly about myself.

Community question: What does 'adventure' mean to you?

Pictured here: An archeologist ascends ropes we fixed to access Neal's 'Sky Caves'. Shot #onassignment for #natgeo.

#discovery #adventure #travel #archeology #nepal #climbing

Shout out to my dear friend and victim (for the shoot), @alexhonnold for putting up with me for the @espn body issue, out today. And a massive thanks to @espn for trusting me with this. //
The first time I photographed Alex Honnold was over a decade ago when our respective cars were our castles, means of transport, and kitchens. I remember the drive from Canada to Yosemite as a jittery sprint fueled by caffeine and gas station cashews. The pictures I took of Alex back then left me wanting, as if there were a depth to his character that was expressed through his action but escaped my ability as a photographer. He struck me as an athlete more sculpted by his medium than any other Iâ€™d met. I wondered if his physical form was a necessary response to repeated stimuli or if he represented something entirely unique. Photographing him all these years later was an opportunity to celebrate him as form born of the stone he surrounds himself with, seeing him as wholly human but somehow simultaneously transcendent of that definition. Plus, itâ€™s not everyday you get to tell your friend to get naked and curl into a ball and NOT have that abruptly make your friendship forever awkward...
//
Check back for more images from this incredible shoot.

It's easy to convince ourselves that environments have moods...and certainly there are belief systems that would hold to that. I tend to think that we bring our emotions to the mountains...and the mountains themselves are the planet's greatest mirror.

On the day I took this image in 2016, we climbed through snow and cloud. The heat caused by the convection cycle triggered repeated small avalanches that would rumble over seracs obscured by a thick fog on either side. This day, and the mood that I was bringing to it was reminiscent of a not so good day I had in the mountains several years ago when one of the distant rumbles became not so distant and engulfed my partners and I. My neuro-chemistry has never recovered.

That day I was looking in the mirror at a fear that I've never overcome. That day, because I was angry, the mountains were angry. As I climbed the slope beneath the seracs (which are almost as safe as they come), I felt my heart rate increase and my breathing become labored. I was scared, and that made me mad.

But the truth is the mountains are indiscriminate. They don't care. They shine when it is sunny and they fall when it is snowy. It's what we bring to them that defines our experience...and maybe even more important, its how we are changed by them and what we bring home and share that matters most.

I am excited, scared, humbled to experience how the mountains will change me on this new journey through a familiar - yet different - landscape.

Continue to #followme + @ladzinski + @estebantopomena to see our real time stories as we now make our way across the Tibetan plateau from Lhasa to #everest basecamp.
#mentalhealthawareness #climbing #adventure #transformation

Throughout the journey to summit Southeast Asiaâ€™s highest peak, Hkakabo Razi, the team and I passed by many religious sites such as Mingun Pahtodawgi near Mandalay, pictured here.

This site has a fascinating history. These remains are the intentionally unfinished stupa project of King Bbodawpaya. The building of the temple took a tremendous toll on the state and resources and, as a result, a false prophecy was created to slowly stop the project. The prophecy has many iterations since creation, but it generally stated that when the project was complete the king would die. At abandonment, Mingun Pahtodawgi stood only 1/3 of itâ€™s intended 150 meter height.

King Bodawpaya also had a 90 ton bell cast to accompany the pagoda, and it still, to this day, holds the record of the 2nd largest ringing bell in the world.

Thanks to @stevemccurryofficial for his tireless and beautiful work that has inspired me and so many other photographers. So much of what we create is reimagined images by those who have come before us. For their guidance, I'm eternally indebted.
Shot #onassignment for #NatGeo Magazineâ€™s article â€œHow A remote Peak in Myanmar Nearly Broke an Elite Team of Climbersâ€

#adventure #travel #culture #burma #myanmar #mingunpahtodawgyi

We just wrapped our final day in Mustang, #nepal. Here are some words about the image I captured above from #NatgGeo #Explorer @jetbutterflies, who helped develop this story and assignment:
.
'A tantric mask rests on an ancient coat of armor in an unnamed ruin near the Tibetan border in Nepal. In Tibetan Buddhism, weapons of war and grotesque figures are used to scare away bad energy and ignorance.

In the isolated Mustang region of Nepal, Buddhist culture is adapting to a number of unexpected changes. The opening of the region to tourism in 1992 sparked an era of prosperity that inspired the revitalization of many ancient monasteries and breathed new life into a shrinking monastic population. Meanwhile, ancient artifacts and valuable religious icons started to go missing and appeared in international collections.'
.
@standtallest @climber.abiral @abovethecloudstrav @sadiequarrier
#natgeo #travel #stilllife #culture

As many of you who have followed me already know, I have -and will continue to- navigate my challenges with mental health. I have a complicated relationship with social media, and regardless of the bad that comes with this platform, I have experienced the positive that comes with loudly and consistently vocalizing around the topic of Mental Health Awareness. Itâ€™s obvious that images of mountains and climbing get the most likes, BUT anytime I post about a personal struggle with mental health, I receive the most comments, private messages and emails. Veterans, stay-at-home parents, athletes, students, women, men..you name the type of person, I can guarantee they have reached out.
.
I encourage voicing the struggles you may experience if you struggle with Mental Health. You are not in this alone, and itâ€™s not just about â€œbeing more happy.â€ Being vulnerable and vocalizing my challenges was the beginning of finding my individual way through PTSD + Anxiety. It helped me find the right people in my life -the ones that listen, care, empathize and understand. I also encourage anyone and everyone that struggles to find the right professional resources for them. The digital world provides opportunity to find and connect with professionals like never before. .
I also encourage those that might not understand what mental health is to google it, read about it, understand it. For a moment, imagine yourself in the skin of another that battles with mental health. Learn to empathize because I guarantee that if you arenâ€™t experiencing it, you are surrounded by people that are. .
On this world Mental Health Day, I encourage you to share below your stories, resources and questions. We are already a community here, letâ€™s use it to our advantage.
.
Pictured here: #Everest expedition 2012, which ended early due to a panic attack.

#mentalhealth #mentalhealthawareness #ptsd #anxiety #bipolar

On the plane to start a new assignment for #natgeo yesterday, I was listening to some podcasts to fill the waiting during travel time, which got me thinkingâ€¦

I admittedly oscillate between â€œwoo-wooâ€ and nihilism. Social media can amplify this, especially Instagram. I feel and see community as much as I experience FOMO and isolation. Thereâ€™s as much support between the scrolls as there is fear of failure.

Iâ€™m going to err on the side of Woo-woo today and open up a conversation - I know a lot of you are following along more for my stories on #everest than my photojournalism or #mentalhealth awareness - regardless I put in the same energy, effort and exploration whether climbing or telling a story (mine or others). And the process of each of these journeys bring me tremendous joy as well as suffering. Different sides to the same coin.
I was reminded by that podcast, by going for a goal, it brings out aspects of you that wouldnâ€™t come out otherwise, so when you reach your next â€œmountain topâ€, and mountain tops are endless, whoâ€™s with you are the people who are supposed to be with you based on what you have become. So, when you are going for a goal, itâ€™s not about achieving, it's about who you are becoming on the way of bringing that goal to fruition.
Iâ€™d like to hear your thoughts - what are some journeys youâ€™ve been on that have made you feel the greatest highs and the lowest lows? Does social media inspire you to keep achieving? Or does it just fill the gaps in-between the day? Do you find you have FOMO, how do you deal with it? Does it effect your goals?

#mountains #adventure #exploration #transformation #onassignment

Reading through the comments from yesterday's post, there's a trend that 'optimistic' 'outrage' was a frequent answer to my question: what type of communication activates you towards change?

In the spirit of these comments, I'd like to share an influential figure on this exact topic.
Recently, I watched a panel discussion that included Christiana Figueres (@cfigueres), the Executive Secretary of UNFCCC (United Nations Framework Convention of Climate Change) who lead the diplomatic collaboration of the Paris Agreement. She frequently uses the concept 'outrage + optimisim' in speaking about climate science. If you're looking to be inspired into action, her twitter account is has some great resources and her TED talk is exceptional, as well. Check her out.

Yesterday's post created some passionate conversation, both in my direct messages and in the comments field. The issue of #climatechange can be polarizing. As a human race, we form our belief systems around what we are taught was well as what we experience first hand. Every person has their own unique experience in life, which means we all have our own individual, and equally real, experience of the world.

I'm curious: What is your unique experience of climate change? What have you or haven't you seen first hand? What makes you believe what you believe?
I'm interested about all experiences. No wrong answer here.

Some people have been asking â€œWhat is Mustang?â€ So: Mustang is a former kingdom in north-central Nepal, and is home to one of the worldâ€™s great archaeological mysteries. Hidden within the Himalaya on walls deeply cleaved by the Kali Gandaki River are an extraordinary number of human-built caves, also known as the 'sky caves.' No one knows who dug them. Or why. Or even how people climbed into them.

I am en route to here, the kingdom of Mustang, for my latest assignment for #natgeo.
Pictured here, daily life against the backdrop of the sky caves - my first published assignment for @natgeo

#Nepal #mountains #travel #culture #onassignment

As some of you have said, we can all do our part in showing up mindfully on this planet, but as the world changes around us, businesses, investors, and financiers have an even larger impact. The finance industry has a responsibility to change the ways they manage economic, environmental and social risks.

Before I settle into Nepal for an upcoming assignment, I am honored to speak at CIMB Investment Bankâ€™s Cooler Earth Summit in Kuala Lumpur. The summit looks to create action and positive impact while simultaneously showing that businesses can remain relevant and profitable along the way.

#Instagram has been a tremendous platform by which to evoke change and conversation around important topics. Beyond the infinite scroll, I, too, have a responsibility to use this â€œinfluenceâ€ wisely, and am actively engaged directly with brands, political organizations, and financiers as they continue to develop ways to mitigate their impacts.

Are there any specific brands or organizations that you wish to see change the way they do business?

Ive taken a few weeks off after coming home. Processing is hard for me sometimes and I have the tendency to go through a pronounced depressive cycle post expedition. It's the fallout from hyper stimulation and it lends itself well to a certain degree of despondency. It's a tremendous privilege to be able to do what I do, so I do my best not to dwell in it. Regardless, it's a truth and a piece of my temperament. The indication that its nearing its end presents in subtle ways...like the desire to make photographs and train slowly emerge and the desire to hide begins to dissolve like a heavy fog lifting. Looking forward to the full sunshine forthcoming.

As a human family, we might just have an inflated sense of self. Maybe it's a developed arrogance or maybe its innate. Regardless, the impact we inflict is undoubtedly severe. As more and more species go extinct in our wake of 'progress', our footprint gets amplified. But I am also hopeful. It's not hard to see the tireless reclamation always taking place around us. It can be seen as a living testament to our integral part of nature, countering the beliefs of many that we are apart from nature. Shot #onassignment for @natgeotravel in the #andamanislands #nature #life

Throughout the kingdom of Mustang, #Nepal, horses have been long connected with the way of life. As a road begins to carve its way through the once remote region, horses are being replaced by motorcycles.

Pictured here, a beauty obscured amidst the aspens while resting between rides in #utah bathed in the light of the sunset. Whether in Nepal or Montana, these creatures evoke an equal sense of awe and fear in me.

A commitment to climbing mountains means a commitment to failure. Something I am reflecting upon with today being National Mountain Climbing Day.
For example, on our quest to summit the highest peak in #myanmar, the expedition team and I were pushed to our limits, brought down to nothing. As a team we collectively made the decision to turn back after a 40+ day attempt. It may seem like a failure by traditional standards, but the best lessons are sometimes learned when your acute discernment is put to the test.

Ladakh, India. DISCLAIMER: Eyerolling emo deep thoughts to follow. Proceed with caution. // I love portraiture above all forms of photography. We are such an amazing creature. We are both creative and destructive, kind and vicious, powerful and meek, beautiful and ugly. It's my belief however that the majority of us dont live in those binary arenas. Very few people are truly good or bad, black or white...rather, we are infinite shades of grey depending on the day, the hour, the minute...even the second. Thinking of ourselves in binary terms is an attempt at comfort which is an injustice that robs us of our unique complexities. And while I've found that all of us embody a multitude of different shades at any given moment, we are all pretty similar as well. For me, photography has often been a way to seize upon perceived differences in order to expose our overarching similarities as a human family and hopefully bring us closer together. Too see one another completely is to see ourselves, regardless of where we were born, the color of our skin, our gender, what language we speak, or which god we pray to. And while there is unspeakable evil in the world, the power of said darkness pales in comparison to the power we achieve when we see ourselves as a whole and constantly unfolding. Shot #onassignment for #natgeo #portrait #culture #travel #photography #portraitphotography #emo

In 2014, I had the honor to travel on the behalf of #natgeo to Franz Josef Land (FJL), an #arctic Russian archipelago inhabited only by military personnel. Similarly to last post, I witnessed first-hand the changing, melting landscape of pristine land. Since this #expedition, scientific studies have concluded that â€œice mass loss from 2011-2015 has doubled compared to any previous time spansâ€. Glacier retreat has been widespread and has led to the creation of at least one new island. Ice wastage, which means the removal of snow or ice from a glacier, was historically relatively small, but accelerating ice loss is the new normal for FJL.

We donâ€™t need to travel to the arctic to experience our changing environment. There are shifts occurring here in my home of the United States, which some of you have spoken about in yesterdayâ€™s postâ€™s comment section. To me, this isnâ€™t a political debate, so letâ€™s continue the conversation about our experiences and how to personally shift to make better choices - better choices for ourselves and our present *and future* global community.

Pictured here: Walruses approach our expedition boat from a haul out on Hooker Island. During summer, when sea ice diminishes, walruses congregate on shorelines, where food is scarce and youngsters can get trampled.
Shot #onassignment for National Geographic Magazineâ€™s â€œFranz Josef Land: The Meaning of Northâ€

Time for another community discussion.

Been on a podcast kick lately and yesterday listened to one about the dichotomy between Belief and Doubt. Believing and doubting are very much two sides of the same coin for me. It follows me through life.. I believe I can accomplish the goals I attempt, yet the journey of exploring this potential success is littered with doubt. Or another example would be: Doubt feeds my discernment on the mountain keeping me safe. At the same time, intense doubt can create stagnation, preventing me from going deeper or trying harder, which as result, could end in final failure.

You all have the floor: Do you believe doubt is essential in having faith? It can be faith in anything. Goals, God, Loveâ€¦ Tell me the things.

'a lot of you have asked about my skincare routine so here it is:
STEP 1: A triple cleanser by Biophiliac, really good brand, they use soybean extract combined with organic microplastics.
STEP 2: A couple of toners, mainly the set you automatically get in the HP LaserJet Pro M102w Laser Printer G3Q35A.

STEP 3: For eye cream I actually use Simply Organic French Onion Dip Mix just make sure it's the 1.1 oz packet because you're dumb to use a whole jar.

STEP 4: This serum called Gunther's Gums it smells like chocolate, and tastes like it too. Make sure you get the big bottle because you'll go through it fast, especially during dessert.

STEP 5: Depends how I'm feeling, but I either go with a face oil like a soybean cooking oil or a hydrating mask from Elmer's glue and tea tree oil.
STEP 6: Obviously I can't go to bed without my night cream moisturizer, the brand is L'Oxidatione Reservoti Panini Avenatti Overnight Hydrating Facial Moisturizer. I get a tub of it from Lithuania.

hope that helps!' #satire #satiregram #meta #counterculture #skincareroutine #skincare #tutorial #itme

the lil beyonces for my 7-11 video. i went through my old box from 2015 and there's over 500 heads in there that i used just from that year and a lot of others i didn't use. so real talk: i'm 99% certain that right now at this moment i have more lil head cutouts in my possession than any human in all of history. like there's been a lot of people in the world, billions and billions, with a lot of different hobbies and interests and im sure someone at sometime probably had a couple hundred lil cutout heads for some reason but (i probably sounds like i'm boasting) i really don't think any of them have collected more lil head cutouts than me. this just has to be the largest private collection of lil heads ever and i'm probably the #1 human in that category right?? and how neat is that??

the joy of creating â€” sundays with bob part 1 (ft. @martinrussocki) ğŸ¨â¤ï¸ğŸ‘ŒğŸ» #mydaywithbob #bobrossemoji.

there is a lot going on in the world. and you SHOULD absolutely care about that stuff. high on the 'to do list of being a good human' (TM) is caring for your fellow humans and striving to make the world a better place. (high on the 'to do list of being a bad human' (TM) is getting mad at people who are trying to be good humans fyi.) but while you're doing that, dont forget to take time to create, to make things, to perfect the act of doing. that can ALSO help make the world a better place.

this is the first part of a new series where i celebrate the act of doing and honor the legendary bob ross, who spent his life reminding people that anyone can create and creating is fun.

bob once said 'talent is a pursued interest. anything that you're willing to practice, you can do.' i believe that. sometimes young people ask me for advice on how to create. i tell them to just start creating. if you do something every day, even a monkey like me can get good at that thing. i believe my art is proof of that.

over the coming weeks i will keep a bob ross cutout on me at ALL TIMES and keep an eye out for artists in the wild. my first artist in this series is martin russocki who i saw painting in washington square park. his work is really lovely and i like it a lot! i hope you do too.

happy sunday, everybody, enjoy the world around you and don't forget to do something today.

this is one of the very first pictures i took back when i first started playing around with the little cutout technique. id found the image in a book on hollywood hunks and carried it around for a couple days. this photo has always been one of my favorites because burt was always so cool, even wearing teal socks with sandals. hard to pull that off. RIP hollywood hunk.

#mydaywithadayjob part 2 (ft. bey handling a forklift, naturally)

the captions for these will be my musings on the benefits of sidework for creatives.

last week i introduced you to the volunteer bookstore. this week iâ€™m introducing you to my new job as a forklift operator. kidding. iâ€™m introducing you to thursdays with ed.

ed is a film historian and author of a bunch of amazing books. he likes a lot of the same movies as me and is pretty mischevious. heâ€™s in his mid 60s and has parkinsonâ€™s. he gets around okay but struggles with certain motor functions from time to time and going outside can be daunting. parkinsonâ€™s is a nasty disease. he never knows when his legs might lock up, leaving him frozen in a busy manhattan intersection.

my job is basically to help him get to a couple appointments and make sure he doesnâ€™t fall over. i also consider it part of my job to make sure ed has a nice day on thursdays. i do what i can.

that first day, i didnâ€™t know what to expect. iâ€™d never looked after someone with parkinsonâ€™s. (i can barely look after myself!) within 5 minutes right after we shook hands he fell over. it wasnâ€™t a hard fall: he landed on his bed. his husband showed me the easy way to get him back on his feet (good to know!) but i thought oh great, iâ€™m gonna be picking this guy up a lot!

now, after a few months, weâ€™ve had a lot of wonderful thursdays. weâ€™ve gone to the movies (the dead donâ€™t die!), talked about religion in the park, discussed love and regrets and had many belly laughs. and since that first day, ed hasnâ€™t fallen once!

the other day, ed noted how few â€œepisodesâ€ heâ€™d had lately. â€œi hope youâ€™re not about to fire meâ€ i said. he replied â€œiâ€™d make up symptoms to keep you around.â€ itâ€™s nice to feel wanted. and thursdays with ed have put me in a different head space than anything iâ€™ve experienced. iâ€™m reflective and protective and i love it.

last week, i told ed about my project about the benefits of side work and i asked him if it was okay if i started writing about our thursdays. â€œi could call you fred?â€ he said â€œyou better call me ed. and after all the embarrasing things iâ€™ve written about other people, you better embarrass me.â€

the year is 2009.
you just dropped out of college and moved home to start a band.
you are angsty and hungover and trying to figure out your life.
you bleach your hair on a whim using boxed bleach from CVS.
10 years later youâ€™re waking up in your new home next to your dog. no hangover, no anxiety, your life pretty figured out. still doing that band you dropped out of college to start. growth is tight. and so is getting your hair professionally done.

1 year ago today I woke up with a horrible hangover and tears in my eyes and I told myself, â€œIâ€™m done.â€ I did a pretty good job of making light of my problem with drugs and alcohol but it eventually reached a point where I knew something had to change. It hasnâ€™t been easy but oh man has it been rewarding. Iâ€™ve never felt more myself than I do today and I owe that to sobriety (and also therapy!) If youâ€™re struggling, just know there is a way out.

Thank you to all of the people who have been there for me the past year of my life while I went through extreme changes, you know who you are. And to the fans who have been patient with me while I figure out how to navigate said changes- you better believe thereâ€™s plenty of songs that came out of this experience. Iâ€™m beyond grateful to be where I am today because a year ago, it didnâ€™t seem possible. And not every day is easy, because thatâ€™s life, but every day is a new opportunity to do things differently and that rules. Iâ€™m basically a walking self help book now, so you better get used to it â¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ» (ğŸ“· by my precious jewel @juanvigoda)

I hope I donâ€™t come off as an ass... A woman just stopped me in the grocery store and told me that she had never seen a basket like mine.I told her that I have never NOT seen this type of basket in my grocery-shopping behavior.A few others chimed in saying that it was a very strange sight! WTF?A strange sight?Iâ€™m in a grocery store.Itâ€™s food.It got me thinking and really fired up...I hear in the news constantly, in legislative bodies debating and the public complaining out right bitching about healthcare costs, drug companies and doctors and what rising costs do to our society, our lives and our economy. I know our system isnâ€™t great.Yet, the public poisons itself daily with bad food choices. Food is medicine and medicine is food. Itâ€™s a fact. If we want to see our healthcare system changed, be a healthier society- and it will. How does that sound? Logical right? I donâ€™t mean to sound like a dick- or preachy but this is nuts: how is it, that grown professional people in a major American city have never seen a grocery basket full of normal&healthy foods that just all happen to be green or not processed.Weâ€™re so far down the rabbit hole of packaged and â€œconvenientâ€ foods that our society is paying the price&so is our future.No one in our government is helping us be healthier through education.Why would they?Sick people are GREAT for business...
Itâ€™s pretty simple:If you want to look well, feel well and BE well- just eat well. Obviously excersise as well, as much as you can.Everything else will start to fall into place.My mom raised me on no money&mostly as a single parent yet, she still ate well&exercised and it shaped my life.We make excuses why we canâ€™t find the time to take care of ourselves and we end up past the point of no return... Why is that?How is it that we canâ€™t see that:Happy and healthy people make a happy and healthy world.Itâ€™s hard to see that through a fog of prescription drugs, energy drinks&strong sleep aids. Itâ€™s hard I know, but its time to change. You wouldnâ€™t put the wrong gas in your car, so why would you put wrong food in your body? We MUST take responsibility for what we put into our bodies starting now. We can do it.Ok.Iâ€™ll stop.Thnks

Iâ€™ll never forget the feeling of helplessness watching our communities here in California burn. Iâ€™m grateful that these destructive flames have stopped due to the hard work and risk of the men and women who fought them from the land and from the air. To our FIREFIGHTERS: We are so grateful for you today and everyday. We love and respect you immensely. To all of our Police and other the 1st responders, emergency professionals and volunteers that went in to save people, homes and animals we thank you from the deepest depths of our hearts. We thank each and every one of you to the stars and back. The @losangelesfiredepartment , you are among the greatest heroes on this planet and your bravery and commitment to protecting our state, our people and our creatures is so powerful and so appreciated. Thank you @lafdfoundation for supporting them. From my family to yours, we thank you all on this day. We can only hope that all those affected by natural disasters this year and in recent years find some happiness and a hug today. Hope is all we have to move forward in these terrible moments but together as community we are strong and can share smiles. I send you all love today and applaud your strength and courage to press on. May we start to talk more seriously about where the increasing number of violent hurricanes and fires, that are destroying our homes and communities are coming from and together pave a road to a more peaceful and less destructive future.
Happy Thanksgiving to all and may today not be about gluttonous consumption but gratitude for the simple things in life, the things that we need to survive: Family, friends and food.
With immense gratitude,
Ian Somerhalder
Mondays...

Me at 17 years old.
An America Eagle campaign in the summer of 1996. This was shot in the middle of no where on famous Route 66 at an old desert cafe in the California. How different 1996 was. I read books with an insatiable thirst for philosophy, history, science and nature as shadows lengthened in the sun. What a time. People talked and talked and talked about life on the streets, in parks, in restaurants and bars. It was a special time. The time before the smartphone. I often think about those times when our focus was experiencing moments and not broadcasting every single moment of our entire lives... there was so much clarity. I miss those times...

The latest instalment of @biekedepoorter's long-running project, 'Agata', is going on show at @parisphotofair this week as part of the @huaweinextimage Awards stand.
.
The project started in November 2017, as a result of Magnumâ€™s Live Lab in Paris. While in the French capital Depoorter was invited to visit an infamous strip club in the Pigalle district where she met Agata, a young dancer working at the club. Agata invited Depoorter back to her home and together they made the very first photographs in what was to become a years-long project. .
Earlier this year the pair travelled to Lebanon to continue the work, with the support of the @huaweinextimage Awards.

There are less than two days left only to buy this print from @raghurai.official in The Magnum Square Print Sale in Partnership with @aperturefnd! Shop the sale via the link in bio.
.
â€œI was shooting in Mumbai city for a book project in 1996. I had heard of local trains arriving into the city with a human deluge that was unmeasurable, a flood of people who would then be dispersed to their places of work. Sure enough, I reached Churchgate railway stationâ€“the busiest place in the heart of the cityâ€“at 8 a.m. I stood there in awe and amazement, with an unimaginable and overpowering feeling of the deluge. It took less than a minute for thousands of commuters to disappear. The platform was empty again until 3 or 4 minutes later, when more trains arrived to bring in another deluge. .
More than the crowds, I wanted to capture so many human bodies melting into each other and disappearing in a mad rush to get to their respective places of work. So I put my camera on a 5 foot-high switch box almost in the middle of the space between two tracks and exposed it at one-eighth of a second in order to capture the deluge. But those sitting on the benches reading the morning newspaper or waiting for someone remained still. This expression is visible anytime of the day in most metropolitan cities in India.â€- @raghurai.official
.
PHOTO: Local commuters at Churchgate railway station. Mumbai, India. 1995.
.
Â© @raghurai.official/#MagnumPhotos
.
#MAGNUMSQUARE #Hidden #India #Mumbai #streetphotography #RaghuRai
